text: Drepanis is a genus of Hawaiian honeycreeper in the subfamily Carduelinae of the family Fringillidae. The birds are endemic to Hawaii. ==Species== It contains the following species: {| class="wikitable" |- ! Image !! Scientific name !! Common Name !! Distribution |- |120px || Drepanis coccinea || ʻIʻiwi || Hawaiʻi, Maui, and Kauaʻi, with smaller populations on Molokaʻi |- |120px || †Drepanis pacifica || Hawaiʻi mamo|| Hawaii |- |120px ||†Drepanis funerea|| Black mamo|| Molokai |- |} ==See also== * * Category:Hawaiian honeycreepers Category:Endemic fauna of Hawaii Category:Bird genera Category:Higher-level bird taxa restricted to the Australasia-Pacific region
title: Drepanis
